Tingkatkan Minat Baca, Disdikbud Kubar Gelar Lomba Menyusun Kalimat
04 Nov 2019, 19:30 by Mikael Carolus Jaang


Tingkatkan Minat Baca, Disdikbud Kubar Gelar Lomba Menyusun Kalimat

KBRN, Sendawar: Dinas Pendidikan dan Kebudayaan (Disdikbud) Kabupaten Kutai Barat (Kubar) melalui Bidang Pembinaan Pendidikan Dasar (PPD) menggelar kegiatan Lomba Menyusun Kalimat/Paragraf bagi pelajar tingkat Sekolah Dasar (SD) dan Sekolah Menegah Pertama (SMP), di Kecamatan Barong Tongkok atau Wilayah Ibu Kota Kabupaten.
Pantauan RRI, sekolah yang menjadi sasaran yakni, SD Negeri 003 Mencimai diikuti 40 peserta dan SPM Katolik WR. Soepratman juga diikuti 40 peserta, yang masing-masingnya dibagi menjadi 4 kelompok.
“Jadi lomba ini dilaksanakan dengan cara menyusun kalimat sesuai isi buku yang menjadi objek perlombaan. Teknisnya buku yang kita jadikan objek lomba itu di fotokopi, terus di gunting per-kalimat atau paragraf. Nah itu yang kemudian diacak, dan harus disusun kembali oleh para Siswa-siswi ini sesuai isi buku yang sebenarnya,” kata Kepala Bidang PPD Disdikbud Kubar Y. Yamon, Senin (4/11/2019).
Menurutnya, para pelajar yang mengikuti lomba sangat antusias, sehingga diharapkan pihak sekolah bisa menindaklanjuti kegiatan tersebut kedepannya.
“Kita lihat tadi, kayak di SD, mereka sangat antusias sekali. Bahkan mereka menganggap waktunya kurang, begitu juga di SMP. Ya mudah-mudahan kedepannya nanti bapak kepala sekolah bisa memprogramkan kegiatan ini di sekolah masing-masing,” ungkapnya
Kegitan ini lanjut Yamon, bukan hanya sekedar lomba, namun lebih kepada upaya untuk meningkatkan minat baca para pelajar ditengah perkembangan teknologi, salah satunya Gadget atau Gawai yang saat ini menjadi magnet negatif. Dimana kebanyakan anak lebih suka bermain gawai dibandingkan membaca buku.
“Kebetulan ini menjadi Proyek Perubahan saya, yaitu Gerakan Hari Anak Membaca atau disingkat Gerhana, nah lomba ini adalah salah satu upaya untuk menuju gerakan tersebut, karena dengan mereka menyusun ulang kalimat inikan secara tidak langsung mereka membaca. Makanya nanti kita harapkan ini mendapat dukungan dari semua pihak termasuk pemerintah. Jadi kita bisa tetapkan harinya, bisa sebulan, dua bulan atau enam bulan sekali. Setelah itu terserah sekolah nanti yang berinovasi, mau buat lomba atau kegiatan lainnya, silahkan. Yang penting ada kaitannya dengan membaca itu,” lanjutnya.
Dalam kesempatan itu, Imanuel Dermawan Parito, salah satu Siswa di SDN 003 Mencimai saat dikonfirmasi dengan polosnya mengatakan, lomba tersebut sangat menyenangkan karena bisa belajar bekerjasama dalam satu tim.
“Kalau inikan pakai kertas, bisa berbagi sama teman-teman dan lebih menyenangkan. Kalau pakai HP-kan dikit-dikit bisa Lowbate Hp-nya. Tapi kalau kayak ginikan lebih bagus, bisa ramai-ramai ngerjainnya,” katanya.
Demikian juga diungkapkan Ishak Gede Agung Pratama. Siswa SMPK WR. Soepratman itu mengaku dengan kegiatan seperti ini lebih nyaman belajar, dan bisa mempertajam kemampuan membaca karena harus teliti menyusun kalimat per-kalimat.
“Kalau permainan seperti ini saya senang, soalnya bisa mempertajam kemampuan kita membaca. Jadi enak kalau kita belajar membacanya kayak gini,” tandasnya.
Untuk diketahui, dalam lomba menyusun kalimat tersebut, Dinas Pendidikan dan Kebudayaan Kutai Barat memberikan hadiah kepada peserta lomba berupa Uang Pembinaan dan Piagam kepada setiap kelompok yang ikut berpartisipasi.

Increase Reading Interest, Disdikbud Kubar Holds Sentence Compilation Competition
04 Nov 2019, 19:30 by Mikael Carolus Jaang


Increase Reading Interest, Disdikbud Kubar Holds Sentence Compilation Competition

KBRN, Sendawar: Department of Education and Culture (Disdikbud) of West Kutai Regency (Kubar) through the Field of Basic Education Development (PPD) held a Contesting Sentence / Paragraph Competition for Elementary School (SD) and First Middle School (SMP) students in the District Barong Tongkok or Regency Capital District.
RRI monitoring, the targeted school, namely SD Negeri 003 Mencimai was joined by 40 participants and SPM Catholic WR. Soepratman was also joined by 40 participants, each of whom was divided into 4 groups.
"So this competition is carried out by arranging sentences according to the contents of the book which is the object of the competition. Technically, the book that we made as the object of the competition was photocopied, then scribbled per sentence or paragraph. Now that is then randomized, and must be rearranged by these Students according to the actual contents of the book, "said Head of PPD Disdikbud Kubar Y. Yamon, Monday (4/11/2019).
According to him, the students who took part in the competition were very enthusiastic, so it was hoped that the school could follow up on the activity going forward.
"We saw earlier, like in elementary school, they were very enthusiastic. In fact they consider the time is less, as well as in middle school. Yes, hopefully in the future, the principal will be able to program this activity in each school, "he said
This activity continued Yamon, is not just a competition, but rather an effort to increase students' interest in reading amid technological developments, one of which is Gadget or Gawai which is currently a negative magnet. Where most children prefer to play gadgets compared to reading books.
"This happened to be my Change Project, the Children's Day Movement for Reading or abbreviated as Eclipse, now this contest is an effort to get to the movement, because by rearranging these sentences they indirectly read. So later we hope this will get support from all parties including the government. So we can set the day, it can be a month, two months or six months. After that it's up to the school later to innovate, want to make a competition or other activity, please. The important thing is to do with reading it, "he continued.
On that occasion, Imanuel Generous Parito, one of the students at SDN 003 Mencimai when confirmed innocently said, the competition was very fun because it could learn to work together in a team.
"If you want to use paper, you can share with friends and have more fun. If you use your cell phone a little, you can Lowbate the cellphone. But if it looks like it is better, it can be busy working on it, "he said.
Likewise, Ishak Gede Agung Pratama also expressed. Middle School Student WR. Soepratman admitted that with this kind of activity it is more comfortable to learn, and can sharpen the ability to read because he must carefully arrange sentences per sentence.
"If a game like this I am happy, the problem can sharpen our ability to read. So it's good if we learn to read it like this, "he said.
To note, in the competition to compose the sentence, the West Kutai Education and Culture Office gave prizes to the participants in the form of Coaching and Charter Money to each group that participated.
